history.content:
Dear L&S students, 

Students are expected to declare a major by the time they reach 60 college units. As a result, the College places registration blocks on students who have 75 total units (completed + in progress) and are currently undeclared. To remove this block, students should complete both pages of the Conditions to Declare form, and then schedule an advising appointment with their intended major advisor. If you intend to major in Computer Science, you may schedule an appointment via CalCentral (instructions here). 

 

Depending on your plan, we may be able to release your block, or we may refer you to an additional advising appointment with an L&S Advisor. 

 

Please Note: Enrollment for Spring 2018 starts October 15th. As more students seek advising around that time, you may struggle to schedule the necessary appointments to take care of this. I would encourage you to address sooner, rather than later.

 

Note that incoming Fall 2018 transfer students will not receive this registration hold regardless of their declaration status.

What is counted toward the 75 units?
  • Fall 2018 in-progress units
  • All completed Berkeley coursework
  • All transfer units, regardless of when the course was taken
      • Unfortunately, the system cannot identify college units completed prior to high school graduation; if you have excessive number of these units placing you over 75 units, contact the College of Letters and Sciences advising office
  • Not counted: Exam credit (i.e., AP and IB credit)

history.subject: CS Intended Registration Block

history.content:
Dear L&S students, 

Students are expected to declare a major by the time they reach 60 college units. As a result, the College places registration blocks on students who have 75 total units (completed + in progress) and are currently undeclared. To remove this block, students should complete both pages of the Conditions to Declare form, and then schedule an advising appointment with their intended major advisor. If you intend to major in Computer Science, you may schedule an appointment via CalCentral (instructions here). 

 

Depending on your plan, we may be able to release your block, or we may refer you to an additional advising appointment with an L&S Advisor. 

 

Please Note: Enrollment for Spring 2018 starts October 15th. As more students seek advising around that time, you may struggle to schedule the necessary appointments to take care of this. I would encourage you to address sooner, rather than later.

 

  • “High school enrichment units" (AP and IB test units) are not included in this count. The system knows not to include them. 
  • Unfortunately, the system cannot identify college units completed prior to high school graduation; if you have excessive number of these units placing you over 75 units, send us an email and we should be able to rectify.
  • Note that incoming Fall 2018 transfer students will not receive this registration hold regardless of their declaration status.

  

#pin
